page.title: 03EFFECT OF TOURISM ON PENNARD
page.content: LOTS OF TOURISTS COME TO THIS AREA WHICH AFFECTS THE LOCAL PEOPLE A LOT, ESPECIALLY THE SHOPKEEPERS WHO SELL MORE IN THE TOURIST SEASON. THE SHOPKEEPERS SELL MANY MORE THINGS TO TOURISTS. SOME SHOPS SELL SPECIAL PRODUCTS TO TOURISTS LIKE BEACH SHOES AND TOYS. THE CRAFT SHOPS GET THE MOST TOURISTS BECAUSE MOST OF THE TOURISTS WOULD RATHER BUY SOUVENIRS OF THEIR STAY. THE SHOPKEEPERS ARE FRIENDLY TO THE TOURISTS AND HELP THEM A LOT BY SHOWING THEM PLACES TO GO. SOME LOCAL PEOPLE DO BED AND BREAKFAST AND RUN GUEST HOUSES. THE ATTITUDE OF THE LOCAL PEOPLE CHANGES WHEN THE TOURISTS DROP LITTER AND SPOIL THE AREA AND BEACHES.LOCAL PEOPLE SEEM TO BE MORE AWARE OF RETAINING THE BEAUTY OF THE AREA THAN THE TOURISTS.
